segment.documentation: BGM, A segment specifying the functional use (e.g. request) of the Classification information set message.
DTM, A segment identifying the message preparation date/time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify references such as the request message to which the current message relates, and related date and time.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify the reference number.
DTM, A segment to specify the date and time of the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the sender, the requester (if the message function is a response to a request) and other relevant parties, their reference and the communication contact inside the corresponding organisations.

segment.documentation: PNA, A segment identifying a party.
ADR, A segment identifying the address of the party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving contact information.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a person or department for the party identified in the PNA segment and to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment containing communication information for the contact identified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying a classification or a table of links, and defining the items and, if the list is hierarchic, the levels in the classification or table of links.

segment.documentation: VLI, A segment identifying a classification or a table of links.
DTM, A segment defining the interval of validity and other relevant dates for the classification, or the table of links.
EQN, A segment defining the number of objects (e.g. levels or items) in the classification or the table of links.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying a responsible agency for the classification or the table of links and its role (e.g. compilation, ongoing maintenance, dissemination).

segment.documentation: PNA, A segment identifying an agency and its role.
LAN, A segment identifying the language of the agency.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments giving contact information.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a person or a department for the agency and to whom communication should be directed.
ADR, A segment defining address details for the contact person or department.
COM, A segment containing communication details for the person or the department identified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments defining a status event for the classification or the table of links such as created, updated or deleted and the relevant dates of the status event.

segment.documentation: STS, A segment identifying a status event for the classification or the table of links.
DTM, A segment defining relevant dates for the status event.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments identifying a property for the classification, or table of links.

segment.documentation: ATT, A segment identifying a property function and a property type.
DTM, A segment defining an interval of validity and other relevant dates for the property.
ELM, A segment identifying the data type and format of the property value.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments defining a textual property value.

segment.documentation: CAV, A segment defining a characteristic of a textual property value.
FTX, A segment defining a textual property value and the language of the text.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments defining a status event for the property and the relevant dates of the status event.

segment.documentation: STS, A segment identifying a status event for the property.
DTM, A segment defining relevant dates for the status event.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments identifying a structure component in a classification, or a table of links.

segment.documentation: SCD, A segment identifying the type of structure component (e.g. level, item or link) and the component itself.
DTM, A segment defining the interval of validity and other relevant dates for the structure component.
EQN, A segment defining the number of structure components in the identified level of hierarchy structure, such as the number of items in the level.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments defining a status event for the structure component and the relevant dates of the status event.

segment.documentation: STS, A segment identifying a status event for the structure component.
DTM, A segment defining relevant dates for the status event.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments identifying a property of the structure component.

segment.documentation: ATT, A segment identifying a property function and a property type.
DTM, A segment defining an interval of validity and other relevant dates for the property.
ELM, A segment identifying the data type and format of the property value.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments defining a textual property value.

segment.documentation: CAV, A segment defining a characteristic of a textual property value.
FTX, A segment defining a textual property value and the language of the text.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments defining a status event for the property and the relevant dates of the status event.

segment.documentation: STS, A segment defining a status event for the property.
DTM, A segment defining relevant dates for the status event.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments identifying a source or a target related structure component (e.g. item or level) of a link and defining the status and properties of this component.

segment.documentation: IDE, A segment identifying the related structure component such as a level or an item in a link.
DTM, A segment defining an interval of validity and other relevant dates for the related structure component.
EQN, A segment defining the number of structure components in the identified level of hierarchy structure, such as the number of items in the level.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments defining a status event for the related structure component and the relevant dates of the status event.

segment.documentation: STS, A segment identifying a status event for the related structure component.
DTM, A segment defining relevant dates for the status event.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments defining a property for the related structure component.

segment.documentation: ATT, A segment identifying the property function and the property type.
DTM, A segment defining an interval of validity and other relevant dates of the property.
ELM, A segment defining the data type and format of the property.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments identifying a textual property value.

segment.documentation: CAV, A segment identifying a characteristic of the textual property value.
FTX, A segment defining a textual property value and the language of the text.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments defining a status event for the property and relevant dates of the status event.

segment.documentation: STS, A segment identifying a status event for the property.
DTM, A segment defining relevant dates for the status event.
